{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3289905,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-20T15:32:19.959Z","cooked":"

I started a detailed review of the pure python port last night, expect to finish it later this weekend. The good news is that for the most part it’s just a lot of nitpicking and ensure docs work and removing deprecated stuff… only one real bug so far.

As stated elsewhere the beta version of commands is available right now and for the most part I don’t expect the APIs to change all that much. Add this to your pyproject.toml and do robotpy sync to get started:

#
# Use this configuration file to control what RobotPy packages are installed
# on your RoboRIO
#

[tool.robotpy]

# Version of robotpy this project depends on
robotpy_version = "2024.1.1.3"


# Other pip packages to install
requires = [
    "robotpy-commands-v2==2024.0.0b4"
]

Thanks for your patience.

PS: magicbot works great too
